thread.title: Storm Doris batters KLM passenger jet as it comes in for very shaky landing at UK airport
thread.title_full: Storm Doris batters KLM passenger jet as it comes in for very shaky landing at UK airport

author: jshammas
title: Storm Doris batters KLM passenger jet as it comes in for very shaky landing at UK airport
text:
NERVOUS FLYERS LOOK AWAY Storm Doris batters KLM passenger jet as it comes in for very shaky landing at UK airport 
The intense conditions are wreaking havoc across Britain BY JOHN SHAMMAS 23rd February 2017, 11:26 am THIS is the horrifying moment a passenger plane is battered by intense gusts as it tries to land at a British airport as Storm Doris continues to wreak havoc. Thankfully, the pilot makes a last-minute swerve to get the nose of the plane straight 
As the plane begins its descent, it can be seen being turned sideways by gusts. 
Thankfully the pilot manages to pull off the awkward landing by turning the nose of the plane straight just moments before it touches the runway. 
Today commuters are being warned not to make unnecessary journeys with widespread reports of flights being grounded and speed limits imposed on trains. Related stories it's doris day! Storm Doris causes travel chaos with flights cancelled, thousands left without power and a FOOT of snow as UK weather sees 87mph winds 'WE WILL REBUILD' Storm Doris fails to dampen spirits as hilarious Brits post images showing 'devastation' GUST MORNING BRITAIN Storm Doris batters GMB reporter Juliet Dunlop live on TV as weather bomb smash into UK BATTEN DOWN THE HATCHES! Army on standby with Storm Doris set to batter all of UK today amid fears 80mph winds will damage buildings and cause travel chaos STORM CARNAGE Schoolboy, 13, injured as tree crashes onto car with him inside it as Storm Doris hits Britain 
The Met Office’s amber weather warning alerts people that “whilst the strongest winds look to be only short-lived, damage to structures, interruptions to power supplies and widespread disruption to travel networks are likely, with a danger of injury from flying debris”. 
A weather warning for snow is also in place for Scotland, which could see “treacherous” and blizzard-like conditions today. Rex Features People struggle in strong winds and rain as Storm Doris arrives in London 
Storm Doris is expected to move on quickly, with the worst of the weather gone by tonight. 
Heathrow Airport issued a warning yesterday that flights were set to be delayed or cancelled, and on Twitter it reiterated the warning today. Strong winds forecast today are expected to cause some delays and cancellations. Please check your flight status: https://t.co/zOqJyQR48T 
An Aer Lingus aircraft was also spotted wobbling from side to side as it made a shaky descent into Leeds Bradford Airport this morning. 
Snow is expected to hit Scotland with large parts of the country warned to prepare for flying debris, power cuts and even damage to buildings. 
Heavy rain today could also cause flooding in parts of Northern Ireland, southern Scotland and northern England, forecasters warn. PA:Press Association A jack-knifed car transporter near Banknock on the M80 near Falkirk during early morning snowfall scott@scottbairstowphotography.co.uk It has been a tough morning on Britain’s roads, with motorists told to take extra care 
The Army confirmed it would be on hand to tackle any disruption caused by the severe weather. 
A MoD spokesman said: “Our Armed Forces are committed and professional and are ready should they be needed to support local authorities in responding to adverse weather in our communities.”
